programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: Host Ryan McVinney takes Boat Trader fans on an indepth exploration of Florida flats fishing deep in the backcountry of Islamorada. Featuring Captain Eric Lund, a Wall Street Broker turned backcountry fishing guide, this episode reveals the key design features of the world’s best flats skiffs and how they are built for targeting some of the most exciting sportfish species on the planet. Also, covered are bay boats and their versatility for families exploring Florida’s coastal waterways, along with a detailed study of fish species and wildlife in the region. Some of the area’s most beautiful and secret locales show why Islamorada has earned the nickname of the Sportfish Capital of The World.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. That’s where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4—and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredients—from sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintan’s kitchen.

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: We researched all we could about fly fishing for grouper. Nothing came up. Normally a deep water fish, in Ozello Florida you can find gags in just a few feet of water, hiding in cracks waiting to ambush anything that swims overhead. Watch and see what we discovered. #fishingwithjay

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: Jay and Casey link up with Captain Mike Holiday to chase giant jacks off the beach. Casey got schooled last time, he's looking for redemption.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Join Captain Josh and Sheriff Eric Aden for a day of fishing and fun in Destin, Florida. These two friends hit the water, catching fish both offshore and inshore, and reeling in some impressive catches. With plenty of laughs, great stories, and a few surprises along the way, this episode is all about the joy of fishing and the bond between two guys who love the sea.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Denise Sanchez was awarded a hunt at G2 following our Hunters Extravaganza drawings. Its great to get to spend time on the ranch with new members of TTHA. Denise gets familiar with a giant and learns about new technology while on this hunt.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We love our college chapters. Hudson has been a long time member of TTHA as well as serving with the Texas A&M Chapter. We have a great time at G2 in pursuit of Axis deer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Each year we get to spend time in camp with some of our best friends. Zach from Big & J gets some time in a blind while reflecting on what hunting in Texas means to him. Texas provides a wide variety of game, and chasing these creatures all across the state is some of the best times had.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: In 2010, Amberly Snyder’s life changed forever when an accident left her paralyzed from the waist-down. Her comeback story not unlike something you’d see in a movie…in fact it inspired one. Disabled Outdoorsmen USA contacted TTHA and set up this hunt and we were fortunate enough to be able to capture just some of Amberly’s story and her harvest of a beautiful Axis buck at the G2 Ranch in the spring of 2022.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: They say you come to New Zealand as a stranger, but leave as family. In this episode of DIRT, the crew goes full circle—meeting Muttonbird chefs Emma and George on the South Island before hopping up to Raglan and working their way back down. Water skiing next to snow-capped mountains, cooking in hot springs the Māori way, and stargazing at Wairarapa Dark Sky Reserve are all on the itinerary. But it’s the final “Feed” done Kiwi-style that makes one thing clear—in this unique and stunning land, nobody’s a stranger for long.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain Elk Foundation
programme.desc: “Part of our responsibility as citizens in this country is to make sure we not only take care of these resources but we hand it off to the next generation in better condition that we found it.” -Bob Ziehmer, Senior Director of Conservation for Bass Pro Shops & Cabela's Join Bob in New Mexico as he talks about taking care of our natural resources for future generations. Special thanks to Express UU Bar Ranch

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: After 3 years, Tyler kills “Stomper,Jr.” and he just might be the new Louisiana state record buck. We scored him at 203" gross and 193" net typical. We thoroughly enjoyed chasing this magnificent animal in Louisiana with our good buddies Drew Keith and Cole Cooper. Hope you enjoy watching this video just as much as we enjoyed putting it together!

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Rigsby Stewart makes a move to punch his tag in Nebraska! Nothing came easy on this hunt! Multiple different weather conditions and wind directions proved challenging!

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Filming your own bow hunts can be challenging. Throw in some crazy rut chaos and it can be just about impossible. Bouncing around in a Summit climber proved to be a deadly tactic for Bryan Brown as he was able to get tight to the bedding area where 5 bucks were chasing 1 hot doe.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Riley Green, Greg Camp, and Ben McDonald cap off an incredible 2024 hunting season with 2 epic hunts down in Louisiana.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake and a fellow guide search for redfish along the beach, but Mother Nature has other ideas and gives them a show they didn’t expect.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: For Capt. Justin Leake, sight fishing the beach is one of the most productive, and FUN ways to fish. When that doesn’t work, Capt. Todd Jones suggests fishing an artificial reef, and as it turns out, that’s where dinner lives.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith McCord arrives in late spring and joins Capt. Justin Leake on the hunt for a fish she’s never caught before. Lo and behold, it’s a day fit for a king.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: With Meredith McCord halfway around the world, Capt. Justin Leake gives show producer Chris Hermans his first shot at landing a tarpon after filming them for 9 seasons. Does art imitate life?

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team is at John’s lake house on Tupper Lake, NY, where they are tackling a new paint Job using Interlux’s paint specifically designed for aluminum hulls. John and the crew take us step by step on what takes to paint on aluminum hulls as well as some other tips from guest hosts.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team does a deep dive into a product founded by Engineered Marine Coatings called the Genius Bucket. The Genius Bucket being the ultimate DIY paint kit for those looking to tackle a marine painting job on there own. The team also checks out the capabilities it takes to restoring the older metal rub rail which derived from the Glastron project.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Opening day in Mississippi has arrived and Slade is taking full advantage of it! With the weather not cooperating Slade and Zeb stumble into a turkey hunt they won't soon forget. Two days later, the hot streak continues with Slade connecting on another turkey on an 83 acre property he has for sale! Also, Slade gives some tips and his ideas on small acreage hunting, and how it can be just as lucrative as big tracks of land!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and his son take on the turkey woods for an afternoon hunt. Although the woods remained quiet, a tom soon snuck out of the woods and on the end of Bentley's barrel! After that Slade was able to help a client of his harvest his first turkey! And boy was it an action packed hunt! Jakes, hens, and tons of gobbles, This hunt is spectacular! Lastly, Slade introduces a property that we have already made a video on, but with just how amazing the land is, we had to include it! Floweree is the epitome of a sportsman's paradise!

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake and a fellow guide search for redfish along the beach, but Mother Nature has other ideas and gives them a show they didn’t expect.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: For Capt. Justin Leake, sight fishing the beach is one of the most productive, and FUN ways to fish. When that doesn’t work, Capt. Todd Jones suggests fishing an artificial reef, and as it turns out, that’s where dinner lives.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith McCord arrives in late spring and joins Capt. Justin Leake on the hunt for a fish she’s never caught before. Lo and behold, it’s a day fit for a king.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: With Meredith McCord halfway around the world, Capt. Justin Leake gives show producer Chris Hermans his first shot at landing a tarpon after filming them for 9 seasons. Does art imitate life?

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: For decades, Paul Butski has set the standard in turkey calling. His name is etched into the NWTF Grand National Calling Championships Hall of Fame, and his influence stretches far beyond the stage. He didn’t just win competitions, he shaped the way we talk to turkeys – and more importantly, the way we hunt them.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Todd Rogers embraces the business of being a hunting outfitter as a labor of love. And while so many family-run operations are dwindling in rural America, the Rogers legacy is here to stay. Will Cooper and Josh Dahlke return to western Oklahoma to share this story while pursuing brush-country whitetails in the red dirt.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Ismael Garcia was just a young soldier when a tragic incident in Afghanistan changed his life forever. He was left wounded and scarred, but the hardest part came after he returned home. Hunting had always been his escape. But after war, everything felt different — until he picked up a bow.
If you hunt big whitetails this is a must see! Follow Adam Hays and Lee Lakosky as they hunt for multiple giants and learn some tactics for harvesting monster whitetails!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Batter Batter Swing………. Well, you might see where this might be headed. But, Hey!! Slade is in the great state of Kansas. Its mid-October and hes looking to bring home Lori some extra home décor.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: A Southwest Mississippi GIANT “Barry” has Slade’s brain in scrambles as he is preparing to head to Iowa after waiting 5 years to finally draw his tag. The chase is on let’s see if the Hunting Land Man can seal a deal!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: A Southwest Mississippi GIANT “Barry” has made more daylight appearances than possibly any mature bucks in existence. Now that Slade is back from the midwest The chase is on.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike joins a local legend in the waters of Amelia Island, exploring its rich fishery and targeting redfish, trout, and more in this coastal gem.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike joins Capt. Ozzie in Captiva, FL where the action is fast and furious and they chase down an inshore slam in this beautiful Florida fishery.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike and Capt. Glenn Taylor fish their home waters and pay tribute to dear friend Capt. Billy Nobles.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: On a crisp Iowa November morning, everything comes together as Drake Lamb with Midwest Whitetail grunts in a massive 8-point buck that he encountered before with the WoodHaven Midwest Grunter. This is one hunt you don’t want to miss!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Colten & Mark Scroggins is in Oklahoma during the peak rut, chasing mature whitetail bucks! With bucks on the move and searching for does, it's the perfect time to break out the calls. Watch as Mark and Colten pull out all the stops—getting aggressively loud with the WoodHaven "Intimidator" Grunt Call—to turn a cruising buck and bring him right into bow range at the blind.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: After years of chasing one of the oldest and most elusive bucks he's ever encountered, Phillip Vanderpool uses the WoodHaven Initmidator grunt call to finally gets his shot at Tinman, a legendary 10.5-year-old buck in Kansas.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: In Missouri, we join Avery Epperson on the home farm with one goal in mind—catching up with a legendary buck known as Old Monroe. It doesn’t take long before the hunt heats up as the crew spots their target and works to grunt him into bow range. Hunting over a lush green plot on the home farm, Avery gets the chance every whitetail hunter dreams of.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jacob Pentecost and Easton Thompson head to Illinois for the youth hunting season. With hot weather and slow deer movement, the hunt proves to be a challenge. After days of patience and persistence, Jacob finally gets the opportunity to fill his tag!

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: It's a trip back to Southwest Florida to chase after Redfish and Snook. Plus, a special tour of the Costa Custom Boat Factory

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Snapper and Grouper out in the Gulf of Mexico are waiting for Brandon Simmons and Eric Davis. They just have to ride the sporty chop to get to them.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: After a tough week of hunting in Ohio, Chancey Holdsworth of Buckventures, heads to the Southern Illinois hardwoods where the bucks are on the move. From close encounters to a couple of mishaps, the action builds until Chancey comes face to face with a mature Illinois buck!

Getting engaged for a fourth time, Victoria believes she's found the right man -- until on a train she has a strange dream about a Native American who claims that he is her true love. Awakening, Victoria is startled to find the dream man, George (Cornel Wilde), who claims to really exist, while also being a figment of her imagination. Back at home, George guides Victoria to a startling discovery.

programme.title: The Trouble with Angels

To make ends meet, he takes a job as a teacher in a rough London East End school populated mostly with troublemakers who were rejected from other schools for their behavior. While the students at first see Thackeray as just another teacher open for ridicule and bullying, his calm demeanor and desire to see them succeed gradually earn him their respect.

programme.title: It Happened One Night

programme.desc: The Civil War has ended, the Union Army has pulled out, and now the Texas Rangers are needed once again to protect their state from harm. The newly reformed Rangers decide to take a chance by hiring a notorious outlaw Johnny Carver (George Montgomery). They offer the desperado amnesty for his previous crimes if he'll put his famous trigger finger to work for Texas. Carver agrees, but his new job won't be easy, as his old rival, the Sundance Kid (Ian MacDonald), is out for vengeance.

programme.title: Riders of the Badlands

programme.desc: The Durango Kid attempts to ease tensions between ranchers and miners over the cause of polluted water.

programme.desc: An Eastern milquetoast (Joe E. Brown) takes on outlaws in the Wild West.

Now, Martin is the deputy sheriff of a small Arizona town with nothing to do but pull over beautiful local socialite Janice Kendon (Victoria Shaw) for occasional speeding -- until a mysterious murder at a nearby ghost town requires him to put his old skills to use once again. With the help of Sheriff Edwards (Edgar Buchanan) and Kendon, Martin must unravel a murderous plot involving stolen gold.

programme.title: Conquest of Cochise

programme.desc: An Army captain (Buck Jones) fights land-grabbers and woos a Mexican beauty (Carmen Bailey) in California.

programme.title: The Man From Colorado
programme.desc: In Colorado at the end of the Civil War, Col. Owen Devereaux (Glenn Ford), affected by four years of brutal bloodshed, orders the massacre of a Confederate unit, even as they try to surrender. Devereaux's friend and second in command, Capt. Del Stewart (William Holden), is the only one aware of the surrender attempt. Devereaux returns home to a hero's welcome and is appointed a judge, yet his irrational and angry behavior continues, affecting his fianceé, Caroline (Ellen Drew), as well as Del.

programme.title: The Cowboy Star
programme.desc: A disenchanted movie cowboy proves to be a genuine hero when he's forced to shoot it out with a gang of desperadoes.

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Four soldiers of fortune are hired by a wealthy rancher to rescue his beautiful young wife who has been kidnapped by a villainous Mexican bandit. When they finally find her, after fighting their way across deserts and mountains, they discover she is not being held against her will. This causes friction within the band as to whether they should honor their agreement.

programme.title: Snake River Desperadoes
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) squares off against men who are trying to ignite a war between whites and American Indians.

programme.title: Secret Patrol
programme.desc: A Mountie (Charles Starrett) works under cover to solve the murder of his best friend.

programme.title: Cowboy
programme.desc: A Chicago hotel clerk smitten with the daughter of a trail boss’s business partner goes on a cattle drive with him to Mexico through the real West.

programme.title: Laramie Mountains
programme.desc: The Durango Kid learns that crooked scouts are behind attempts to escalate a war between a local tribe and the cavalry.

programme.title: Two Rode Together
programme.desc: For a fee, hard-drinking Texas marshal Guthrie McCabe (James Stewart) agrees to help Army officer Jim Gary (Richard Widmark) search for a group of whites who were abducted years earlier by Comanche warriors. After rescuing two of the abductees, McCabe and Gary find that the former captives have fully adopted the culture of their American Indian captors and are barely recognizable. Cultures collide as they attempt to return the settlers to their original -- and now long-forgotten -- lives.

programme.title: The Son of Davy Crockett
programme.desc: President Ulysses S. Grant enlists a frontiersman's son to help insure the inclusion of Texas into the Union.

programme.title: They Rode West
programme.desc: Dr. Allen Seward (Robert Francis) is the new doctor at a remote Army outpost. His liberal attitudes towards Native Americans become a source of tension between him and his superiors, especially Capt. Peter Blake (Philip Carey), who regards all Native Americans as dangerous and untrustworthy. Seward's insistence on treating several local Kiowa tribespeople for malaria further enrages Blake, who deems Seward a traitor when the Kiowa join forces with the Comanches and attack the fort.

programme.title: Sierra Stranger
programme.desc: Jess Collins, a poor miner, helps Sonny chase off two men he calls claim jumpers. When he arrives in the nearby town, he learns Sonny is no good and everyone in town is against him.

programme.title: The Fighting Frontiersman

programme.title: Saddles and Sagebrush
programme.desc: A rancher (Russell Hayden) joins an outlaw gang to figure out how to stop it.

programme.title: Ride Beyond Vengeance
programme.desc: Based on the novel by Al Dewlen.

programme.title: Last of the Comanches
programme.desc: A cavalry sergeant (Broderick Crawford) leads soldiers, civilians and an Indian (Johnny Stewart) on a desert trek.

programme.desc: Pride faces more repercussions from the FBI after he helps a former Navy Intelligence Analyst who is the primary suspect in a multiple homicide case.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: Sylvester goes under cover in a federal prison in hope of saving three judges' lives; the team must orchestrate a prison break when Sylvester's life is threatened.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: An explosion sends a top-secret submarine to the bottom of the ocean with limited oxygen, a self-destruct function that's about to activate, and Walter, Cabe and Happy on board.

programme.desc: The members of the team go under cover on a movie set in Kazakhstan in hopes of disabling a Soviet-era nuclear missile being sold by terrorists.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: To stop a dangerous virus from spreading, Team Scorpion must locate an endangered monkey in the Amazon that has the antibody for the cure; Toby and Happy see a counselor to prepare for matrimony.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The CSI team, with the help of local tipsters, fights to save a neighborhood on the brink of being taken over by a violent street gang.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The CSI team uses radical technology to unlock the secrets of a man's mind when he shows up covered in blood with no memory of where he has been.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: When a murder occurs during a horse race, Horatio discovers that Ryan has a personal connection to the case.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Alexx Wood comes back when a murderer puts Ryan's and Calleigh's lives at risk.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The CSI team makes a shocking discovery about its murder victim; Horatio tries to save his son from Julia's erratic behavior.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team goes on a manhunt when one of its own is killed; a team member must choose which one of their kidnapped loved ones will survive.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Following the murder of an important family member, the team searches for Delano and Wo Fat.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett asks Catherine to help find his mother; the teams seek assistance from August March (Edward Asner) with a deadly art heist.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Danny and McGarrett's day at sea takes a deadly turn when their boat is hijacked.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett's mom pays him an unexpected visit while the team investigates a polo player's death.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: As the team investigates a grisly murder, evidence suggests the killer is about to strike again.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Danny must hold completely still as technicians disarm a bomb he accidentally activated; McGarrett tries to distract his partner by sharing a story about a tough case.

programme.desc: While returning from capturing a war criminal, Mac and Jack's helicopter crashes, allowing the prisoner to escape.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team closes in on a serial killer (Tim Curry) holding Detective Spicer's daughter hostage.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: JJ tries to reunite parents with their missing daughter; the team braces for the loss of one of its own.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When several women are murdered, Rossi revisits a 25-year-old case that causes him to suspect a killer is at work again.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team searches for a serial killer who is preying on married couples; Hotchner looks to a team member to fill JJ's vacant role.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team pursues a serial killer targeting families in the Midwest; Morgan receives a visit from Ellie after she runs away from her foster family.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The village of Midsomer Mallow is one of the villages hoping to win the title of the "Perfect English Village" competition. As the story unfolds, not everything is "perfect" as local thief Peter Drinkwater is stabbed with a pitchfork at an abandoned farm, he's using as a squat. Shortly after robbing a retired actor's home. Despite the villagers' best efforts to keep the murder quiet so as to not ruin their chances in the competition, several further deaths occur eventually bringing Detective Chief Inspector Barnaby back several decades to uncover the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Whilst the Upper Marshwood hunt assemble outside the village inn, a filthy tramp-like man leaves the shop and skulks into the wood. Soon after, he hears the sound of the hunt begin and the unforgettable noise of the horses and hounds in hot pursuit of the fox. Running for cover, towards the safety of his home-made shelter, he stumbles and falls into a pit - screaming. LIZA, isolated in the disused railway carriage which constitutes her home, moves deeper into the wood having heard the scream. She finds the pit and sees the tramp lying crumpled on the ground, clearly dead. She stares at him for a moment, then turns and walks away.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The closing of what was once a very popular public garden in Midsomer Deverell sparks a series of murders that have Inspector Barnaby and Sgt. Troy stumped.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Following the funeral of local hotelier Karl Wainwright, his hotel's manager and a well liked Punch and Judy performer, Gregory Chambers, disappears unusually in yet another picturesque Midsomer village. Most people dismiss his disappearance completely but when he doesn't turn up, a search is conducted and a severed hand, confirmed to be Gregory's, turns up in the woods. Further deaths and a mushroom poisoning occur surrounding the beneficiaries of Karl Wainwright's will. All is not as it seems.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A man's naked body found under mysterious circumstances, within a crop circle on Sir Harry Chatwyn's wheat field, leads police to investigating how he wound up in the field after being electrocuted. While the nearby village of Midsomer Parva is abuzz with UFO mania, Barnaby is unconvinced by a local ufologist that the man's death was the result of alien activity, as he uncovers rivalries, theft and hatred during his investigations, soon after a well known burglar is found dead in another crop circle with identical injuries.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Returning home one night, in a drunken state, the local doctor of Newton Magna calls in the police after he had accidentally hit a man, yet when Barnaby and Troy arrive, the injured man is nowhere to be found. As they investigate the mystery, Barnaby encounters an old adversary who is working to help renovate the village and whose daughter is getting married to a local boy. Matters soon become complicated, when the body of the best man's father is found in a well that was being renovated, whom the detectives soon discover had disappeared on the day he was planning to run away with a local farmer's wife.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Dave Cutler, Goodman's Land's amorous postman, is found almost decapitated near the common early one morning. Newspaper girl Holly Reid (Kate Maberly) tells Barnaby that she heard music playing faintly nearby. Barnaby and Troy are aided in their investigations by local WPC Jay Nash (Gillian Kearney).

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A woman is killed after receiving threatening letters, setting off a chain of murders for DCI Barnaby to investigate.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the village of Midsomer Wellow, someone is killing off the bell ringers of the parish church, in the week before a big bell-ringing competition. One young woman on the team is even shot dead in the churchyard on her wedding day.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Some of the residents of Midsomer Worthy are trying to prevent James Harrington from turning Setwale Woods into a housing estate. Led by a solicitor, Bernadette Sullivan, and a local farmer, Simon Bartlett, who also happen to be having an affair, they haven't had much success in court. When Bartlett's wife Victoria is found dead in the woods, Barnaby and Troy must first determine is if her murder is related to the planned development or something as yet unknown. The information provided by two inquisitive children, who see the investigation as a fascinating game, proves invaluable in solving the crime.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: An investigation of a car fire and a bludgeon murder lead Barnaby and Troy to investigate the members of a local reading club which has an agenda that goes beyond books.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby investigates the murder of a boy during a traditional annual race at an exclusive private school but meets with resentment.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The double murder of eccentric widow, Isobel Hewitt, and adulterous doctor, Duncan Goff, lead Barnaby and Troy into finding out more about their personal and private lives in the village of Malham Bridge. While Troy suspects an antique dealer that Isobel befriended is the culprit, Barnaby is not convinced, believing anyone the victims knew when they were alive could have been the murderer, from the doctor's wife to the local owner of a restaurant. Even Isobel's close family and members of a local fly fishing group are suspects as they investigate all possible angles.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Martin Wroath is found dead in his home in Midsomer Worthy, Barnaby is unconvinced that he committed suicide with his own shotgun in an unnecessarily complex fashion. When a second murder occurs on an assault course at a local cottage hospital, in which Wroath was a patient, the detective suspects a link between the two murders, and soon finds a wealth of hatred, jealously and lies, before discovering that rope in the village is mysteriously disappearing.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Joyce is taking part in an open-air art class, being held on the village green of Midsomer Florey, when she discovers the body of an elderly fellow student, Ruth Fairfax, concealed beneath some undergrowth shortly after a session. Just as Barnaby begins to learn that Ruth was not all she seemed to be, officers of the NIS pull him off the case. While Troy is allowed to assist them, Barnaby is left handling a local operation into a spate of thefts, yet he decides to continue his investigations in secret. In doing so, he soon turns up armed robbery, unaccounted stolen money, former criminals, and secret liaisons, before discovering that the NIS investigation is not being as thorough as it should be.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: At his family home in Upper Warden, arrogant actor Larry Smith is killed, when a summer house he walks in to as part of a promotion for the sequel to his hit film, The House of Satan, is suddenly destroyed in an explosion. His family quickly fling accusations for his murder directly at the residents of rival village, Lower Warden, leading Barnaby and Troy to determine if this is the case, especially when Larry's director, another member of the family, is electrocuted while using an exercise bike. It's not long before secrets, affairs and blackmail begin to surface from within the two villages.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: While Troy assists an attractive wildlife liaison officer with an investigation into the illegal sale of protected bird eggs, Barnaby travels to Midsomer Magna to investigate the sudden death of a man, who apparently drowned himself. While there was evidence he was desperately seeking to avoid bankruptcy, and had visited a local millionaire to get back his money from a scheme he had invested in, a post mortem reveals that he had been murdered. The two detectives soon find their investigations crossing over, when a man found to have an illegal collection of bird eggs, is also murdered, prompting concerns that the millionaire's scheme is being used to defraud many, and that someone is willing to kill to keep the scheme going.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Troy tackle two separate cases as Troy prepares to leave Midsomer after his promotion to DI.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby's new Sergeant arrives on the day after the murder of a local shrew occurs, and he is immediately put to work.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Long-suppressed family secrets, stolen ancient artefacts, and a thirty year old death at a Celtic burial site result in a series of murders in present day Midsomer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Midsomer hosts its 12th Annual Literary Festival, an author is found with his neck broken. More writers will die before the winner of the competition is announced.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby builds his new empire one big toy at a time; the men of S&S Aqua Logging deal with last week's fallout; DJ suffers an injury that could take him out of the season; a whole new kind of logging.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The Dreadknots come face-to-face with one of the most fearsome creatures in the river; Shelby and Donna put his new paddle barge to work; DJ returns to work but faces another battle with Craig; the Woodchucks push hard to meet their deadline.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby puts his new toys to work and discovers a huge payday in his own backyard; runaway logs send Craig over the edge; Joe and Coatsy strike out on their own; the Woodchucks battle a crumbling wall ; Jimmy Smith says goodbye.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: When Hurricane Isaac hits the bayou, Shelby Stanga must race to save his logging empire; a string of crew meltdowns at Rygaard sends the site into chaos; Brad and Swilley struggle to get S&S back in the Log-Off after losing their captain.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The Swamp Man attempts a daring rescue of his aging relatives from the rising storm waters; the Woodchucks don't make their deadline and their company hangs in the balance; S&S finally hits a honey hole with the help of Swilley's brother.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Gabe brings in someone very unexpected to fill out his shorthanded crew; S&S' bad luck streak continues when they wreck their boat and get into a fight with the Dreadknots; Joe and Coatsy come up with a new plan to start their own company.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby goes on a treasure-hunting mission and ends up in a race against Belinda; Jesse's lesson on the whistles almost takes Luke out; S&S continues to struggle; the Dreadknots' lucky charm gets destroyed.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby finds a legendary old grave site and the crew has an accident; Levi decides to make some major crew changes; Brad and Swilley are the victims of a prank and they lose yet another assistant; Joe and Coatsy have a tough time keeping steady work.

programme.desc: Rene steals the units in Rancho Palos Verdes, Calif.; Mary's locker reveals a sticky past; Justin demonstrates he can turn a small investment into a big return.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Emily deals with an all-male day in Paramount, Calif.; Justin seeks Ivy's guidance with his vintage Cadillac parts; Kenny speaks up during the auction, and quickly regrets it.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Kenny tiptoes down memory lane in Orange, Calif.; Brandi and Jarrod get to work on a tool locker; Darrell and his granddaughter dig up a creepy find.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Kenny bids on a massive locker; Rene and Casey attempt to go small; Shana and Edwina's mystery box is mislabeled.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell breaks in the new guy; Brandi and Jarrod detect something mysterious in their unit; Justin digs through a decent locker.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers face 10 vaults belonging to the same owner; Ivy draws a nice profit; Mary and Kenny do all of the heavy lifting.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Mary dabbles with Dave's dark arts in Torrence, Calif.; Kenny takes some excavation lessons; Brandi and Jarrod quit horsing around long enough to stumble across a wartime oddity.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rene brings Gunther along to West Covina, Calif., for moral support, but gets annoyed when the older German will not take sides; Darrell stumbles over a potential diamond in the rough; Brandi and Jarrod discover a different national pastime.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: In Huntington Beach, Calif., Darrell's insider information amplifies his investment considerably; Mary's find cooks up some oversized accoutrements; Kenny takes advantage of others' missteps to grab a unit.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Mary needs help managing a tiny parking lot in Van Nuys, Calif.; Ivy goes on the prowl for a bike; Dave scores a therapeutic locker; Justin tries to show the rest of the buyers how to make the most out of a unit.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Phil decides to teach his grandkids the value of a hard day's work by building a football field and culminating in a family football game. But Robertson vs. Robertson competition is further sparked.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Korie still in Africa, Willie and Jep must step in and supervise Bella's sleepover. When a couple boys play a prank on the girls, Willie and Jep prove to be the perfect chaperones for the task.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Korie challenges Willie to come up with a romantic gesture without spending any money. Missy and Jase compete to see who can find a girlfriend for Mountain Man.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase's hopes to win the inaugural Duck Commander Fishing Tournament is buoyed when he is able to enlist the help of legendary angler Bill Dance. Meanwhile, Willie's vanity over his greying beard leads him to make a questionable decision.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase and Jep make a deal with Mia and Merritt to get them to go dove hunting with them. Si tries to make some extra cash by starting a West Monroe tour.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jumping Asian carp have invaded Monroe's waters so Jase and the guys set out to try to stop them from spreading further. Meanwhile, Willie and Si have to run Willie's Duck Diner for the day.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The family spends a weekend at their childhood summer camp, reliving old memories and working to repair a tennis court Willie built twenty years ago. While at the camp, Jep tries to pass a lifeguard swimming test he failed as a teenager.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Rowdy's adoption is finalized and he officially becomes a Robertson. Jase gets his first massage and enjoys it more than he expected.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Willie and Jase lose Si's tea cup, Si makes them go to great lengths to find it. When the entertainment for Gus's 1st birthday party falls through, Jep fills in as a magician.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie, Korie, Jase and Missy take dance lessons from Sadie to prepare for Reed and Rebecca's upcoming weddings. Jase's plan to perform Reed's wedding ceremony may fall through when he waits until the last minute to renew his ordainment.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Si decides to retire to pursue a music career, the family organizes a party in his honor. Meanwhile, Willie, Phil and Jase take a road trip to try to recreate an old duck call for Si's retirement gift. (Surprise performance from ZZ Top!)

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Phil, Willie and Ms. Kay attempt to produce a cooking video for their fans.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Phil decides to teach his grandkids the value of a hard day's work by building a football field and culminating in a family football game. But Robertson vs. Robertson competition is further sparked.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After a big order comes in Willie pushes the Duck Commander team to meet the tight deadline, so Jase and the warehouse guys come up with a plan to build a conveyer belt.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Brotherly competition gets the best of Willie when he ditches his kids' career day to go play golf with Jase. Stepping in for Willie, Phil and Si show up at the school and become the teachers' worst nightmare.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After blowing up one of Phil's dangerously antiquated duck blinds, the Robertson boys hatch a wild plan to build a luxury duck blind in the sky. Meanwhile, Ms. Kay and the Robertson women hold a yard sale.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase feels being COO of Duck Commander entitles him to a new office. But when Willie refuses, Jase hatches a plan to build one anyhow. Willie takes Miss Kay and the grandkids to the petting zoo.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's duck blind maintenance time again and the boys have discovered the waterline is low. At the levee, they realize this is the work of Phil's bucktoothed arch nemesis...THE BEAVER.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's the 40-year anniversary of Duck Commander and this celebration is a redneck Robertson style shindig. To top off the event, Willie decides to construct the world's largest duck call to be revealed at the party.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: To prove once and for all who rules the river AND the boardroom, Willie and Jase revive their childhood rivalry and go head-to-head in a fishing competition with the added challenge of having to sell their catch.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: While out duck hunting, Willie, Jase, and Uncle Si stumble across what redneck's consider nature's most prized succulent treasure--a beehive dripping with wild honey.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie finds out that his daughter Sadie has a new boyfriend, he wants to get to know him, while instilling some fatherly fear--Robertson style.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie decides to expand the Duck Commander brand into the winemaking industry and buys a vineyard...sight unseen.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase volunteers to take the Duck Commander RV out on pick up, but neglects to mention to Willie, he's taking Si, Martin and Jep along for a road trip.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase and Si embark on a turkey hunt for the annual Robertson men vs. Robertson women cook-off to create a feast of fresh wild game. With Phil's discerning palate as judge, the teams pull out all of the stops.

programme.desc: A compilation of the best scenes from all 11 seasons of A&E's hit series Duck Dynasty.

programme.desc: A compilation of the best scenes from all 11 seasons of A&E's hit series Duck Dynasty.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's all hands on deck for the Duckmen when an old high school nemesis challenges them to a good old fashion race... at the local lawn mower competition. But Willie and the guys soon find out that this sport is nothing short of high octane.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Sadie's (Willie's daughter) driver's license test fast approaching, she finds herself in dire need of lessons.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Willie's son (John Luke) leaves Willie's pickup in the driveway with a bone-dry gas tank, Willie and Korie decide that it's time to get the kid his own car.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Duck Commander assembly room gets an unexpected shakeup when a disgruntled Si decides to quit his job. But when Willie hires a replacement that clashes with the duck call room, Jase and the guys quickly become equally miserable at work. Meanwhile, Si turns to Phil for work out on the land turning a routine levee repair into a complete disaster.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie finds his office in shambles and alerts the authorities that the warehouse has had a break in. But soon Willie discovers that the culprit was his brother Jase, who needed supplies for an early morning frog hunt.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When a heat wave envelops West Monroe the air conditioning unit at the Duck Commander warehouse goes down, turning the duck call assembly room into a boiling sweatshop.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Korie decides the junk piles in the Duck Commander warehouse are beginning to reach critical mass, she calls on Willie and the guys to do a little company spring-cleaning. But the discovery of an old Ping-Pong table deep within the clutter quickly turns the chore into an all day table tennis tournament. Meanwhile, Uncle Si realizes that he's many years overdue for an appointment with the local eye doctor and ventures out for some new glasses.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After attending a local radio show as a guest, Willie sees an opportunity to host a show of his own. When the station gives him the opportunity, Willie makes the mistake of bringing Uncle Si on the air with him.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Jase, Si and the guys from the duck call room take a field trip to a brand new local donut shop and quickly find out who amongst them can eat the most delicious treats.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie receives a special gift from a Japanese business associate - a "priceless" samurai sword, which Willie keeps out of the hands of Jase and the guys.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie pushes his work force too far after implementing new "motivational work tactics," and the guys rise up against him and go on strike.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When NASCAR sensation Clint Bowyer pays a visit to the Duck Commander warehouse, Willie and the guys are fired up to spend the day hanging out with the professional racecar driver. But too much enthusiasm about the celebrity's mode of transportation turns into a drag race showdown between Willie and Clint. Phil and Si have their hands full fixing Ms. Kay's barbecue when a trip to the outdoor grill store turns disastrous.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's Willie's turn to play Santa Claus at the local church this year but Uncle Si crashes the party and the event goes south in a hurry. Meanwhile, the family gathers at Phil and Miss Kay's house to celebrate the holidays in true redneck fashion.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog doesn't know it yet, but today's bounty is about to take him on a trip down memory lane and test his investigative chops. With each lead propelling him closer and closer to his childhood haunts, Dog uses old-fashioned detective skills.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's target today seems to have a taste for drugs and a record of reckless driving. The hunt has deep emotional resonance for the team because today is the anniversary of the fatal car accident of Dog's daughter Barbara Katie.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When the co-signer of a bond is also romantically involved with the defendant, sometimes the bondman is put in the middle of a lover's quarrel. But sometimes the defendant is a threat to the community and the cosigner asks the bondsman for protection.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Facing hard time for forging checks, Melissa pulled a vanishing act at her sentencing hearing, bolting from the courthouse in broad daylight. Lucky for her bondsman, Dog and his posse are in Colorado and ready to help.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: For Dog and Beth it's not only another day in paradise, it's their anniversary. Beth is hoping for a romantic dinner with her man, but she knows only too well that for Dog work always comes first.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and Duane Lee can't agree about what role Duane Lee should have in the family business, and the simmering tensions come to a head when Duane Lee is accused of denting Dog's SUV.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is a big-hearted guy and today he's proving it. He's helping Mary Ellen, his friend and fellow bondsman, on a dangerous night hunt for a fugitive she is now regretting bailing out.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When Beth returns to the compound on the Big Island she finds a damaged SUV and two possible culprits--Dog or Justin. Pressed by Beth, Dog offers a third option. The perpetrators are Hawaii's mythical mischief makers--the Menehune!

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The day starts with Duane Lee and Leland facing off in the kind of court rarely associated with the Chapmans...a tennis court. At stake, as always, are bragging rights for which son can claim the title of "Chapman Champ."

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog just can't resist a challenge, especially if it's to help out a friend. Jim is a bondsman and longtime friend of Dog. Jim's son has just started in the family business.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When the local cops put out an APB for a client with a checked past, Dog springs into action. With the aid of the runner's girlfriend the posse heads out to bring him in.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog doesn't know it yet, but today's bounty is about to take him on a trip down memory lane and test his investigative chops. With each lead propelling him closer and closer to his childhood haunts, Dog uses old-fashioned detective skills.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog leads the team on another adrenaline-filled chase in Denver. The fugitive, Robert, has a habit of address-hopping that makes him a difficult target, but Dog refuses to give up and finally tracks Robert down in his latest hideaway.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's latest fugitive, doesn't think small when it comes to illegal drugs: he was carrying almost a pound of methamphetamine when he was arrested. Now he's on the run with his pregnant girlfriend on the high plains of Colorado.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A fugitive with a long criminal record has fled to Hawaii, and the bondsman on the mainland has asked Dog and the Posse for help. Dog doesn't have much information to work with, but he can use the felon's desire to impress his friends to track him down.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: With a long record of violence and abuse and weighing in at over 200lbs, Dog's target for the day does not sound like a gentle giant. When the trail grows cold Dog turns up the heat on the fugitive's brother and sister.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and company head to the Big Island in pursuit of two courthouse no-shows only to find that one of them appears to be posting status updates from Southern California.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: What looks like a routine pick-up turns into a complicated case of betrayal, deceit, as well as quality nail care as Dog and company track down an fugitive alleged to be an abusive boyfriend with one too many friends in his close knit community.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Leland has to attend a Lamaze class before he can join the hunt--another Chapman is on the way! But when Dog starts to go after this accused jewelry thief without his fastest son, he learns that this fugitive puts the "R" in runner.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog likes to say, "The apple doesn't fall far from the tree," and this is a hunt where that is true. So will Dog be able to use one family member's troubled ways to catch another one in trouble with the law?

programme.title: Victim to Verdict: the Matriarch Mastermind Murder
programme.desc: After Dan Markel's murder by two hitmen, his former mother-in-law, Donna Adelson, is now accused of orchestrating the plot; with her son and his girlfriend already convicted, prosecutors allege Donna was the mastermind.

programme.title: Accomplice to Murder, With Vinnie Politan
programme.desc: After dentist Norman Larzelere is shot by a masked man & dies in the arms of his hysterical wife Virginia, police initially suspect a robbery gone wrong. That's until a friend of Virginia's oldest son Jason steps forward, and reveals a twisted plot.

programme.title: Accomplice to Murder, With Vinnie Politan
programme.desc: The murder of hometown hero and NBA star Lorenzen Wright remained unsolved until alleged accomplice Jimmy Martin revealed the location of the murder weapon, implicating Wright's ex-wife Sherra and her yardman Billy Ray Turner.

programme.title: Accomplice to Murder, With Vinnie Politan
programme.desc: In a modern-day tale of Romeo & Juliet with a Florida twist, high schoolers Courtney Schulhoff & Michael Morin found solace in each other amidst a tumultuous family life. When their families force them apart the couple's desperation turns deadly.

programme.title: Accomplice to Murder, With Vinnie Politan
programme.desc: In the peaceful village of Essex Junction, Vermont, Michael Durenleau's life would be cut short with a knife through the heart in the darkness behind Veronica's Tavern after celebratory drinks with his wife Rebecca.

programme.title: True Believers
programme.desc: Yogi Bhajan preaches family values and healthy living through Kundalini yoga, but abuse allegations tear a rift through families and across generations inside his spiritual empire.

programme.title: True Believers
programme.desc: Los Angeles' biggest rehab empire seems too good to be true, offering recovery, community and treatment on scholarship, but its patients get more than they bargained for.

programme.title: Interview With a Killer
programme.desc: The oldest serial killer in America reveals new information about his crimes in his first televised interview; journalist David Scott confronts Gary Hilton about his killing spree when he preyed on hikers in North Carolina, Georgia and Florida.

programme.title: Interview With a Killer
programme.desc: The oldest serial killer in America reveals new information about his crimes in his first televised interview; journalist David Scott confronts Gary Hilton about his killing spree when he preyed on hikers in North Carolina, Georgia and Florida.

programme.title: Opening Statements With Julie Grant
programme.desc: Former prosecutor Julie Grant is joined by a team of top trial attorneys and forensic experts to cover the high-stakes trials that are on the docket, and the crime cases dominating the headlines.

programme.title: Court TV LIVE
programme.desc: Gavel-to-gavel coverage and legal analysis of the nation's compelling trials.

programme.title: Court TV LIVE
programme.desc: Gavel-to-gavel coverage and legal analysis of the nation's compelling trials.

programme.title: Court TV LIVE
programme.desc: Gavel-to-gavel coverage and legal analysis of the nation's compelling trials.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Jeffery Pyne was every parent's dream in so many ways, so many wonder what drove him to commit the brutal murder of his own mother.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Nancy Seaman doesn't denied killing her husband Robert with a hatchet; either she planned it or the murder was a desperate attempt to save her own life after, what she claims, was three decades of physical and emotional abuse.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Scott Amendure thought the "Jenny Jones Show" was the perfect place to reveal to his friend Jonathan Schmitz that he had a crush on him; three days later, Schmitz shot Amendure to death.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Dr. Jack Kevorkian thought it was an act of mercy to help over 130 terminally ill patients die a peaceful, pain-free death; Michigan prosecutors said it was murder and spent years trying to get a jury to agree with them.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Mary Kay Letourneau, 34 year-old married schoolteacher and mother, was having sex with a 12 year old student, and the story grabbed headlines around the world; it's only the first in a series of wild revelations.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Reverend Randall Foos says it was just an unfortunate accident when his car hit and killed 19-year-old Sara Casey as she rode her bicycle, but a civil suit revealed more than the eye could see, or couldn't, that turned this accident into a crime.

programme.desc: An accused car thief jumps off a 36-foot bridge to avoid capture; an armed fugitive on the run breaks into a building full of law school students; a DUI suspect flees by car, foot, and water before deputies capture him.

programme.desc: A high-speed chase across three states; a woman pulled over for speeding flees the scene but still manages to obey traffic laws; suspected auto thieves flee a hit-and-run to hide on a golf course.

programme.desc: A desperate couple hold a truck driver hostage in his own semi; marine patrol deputies chase down smugglers in a high-speed boat chase; officers report a late-night pursuit of a suspect fleeing in reverse.

programme.title: In Search Of

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Host Zach Quinto sets out to discover whether Aliens exist and what evidence we have to prove it. He meets with several people who say they have encountered extra-terrestrial life.

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Zach wants to understand how one can be Superhuman; he meets a man who bent the metal frame of a car door with his bare hands in a moment of crisis; a Shaolin warrior monk who shows Zach some of the secrets to his training.

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Zach charts a journey to determine whether time travel is possible; he meets a man who claims to have traveled back in time due to a secret government program; a group of people living in Liverpool known as time slippers.

programme.desc: Zach visits a Florida man whose brother was killed when their family home was literally swallowed whole by the Earth as well as a series of sinkholes that are forming a series of caves right below the houses of a quaint suburban neighborhood.

programme.title: Killer Cases
programme.desc: An heir to the Halliburton oil dynasty fortune, Jill Halliburton Su, is found dead in the bathtub by her son Justin at her upscale home in a Florida gated community in 2014.

programme.title: First Blood
programme.desc: In rural Epping, N.H., everyone knows Sheila LaBarre as an eccentric widow who loves her rabbits; her turbulent childhood in Alabama, a coma-induced vision, and the death of her wealthy husband all send Sheila on a warped mission to kill.

programme.title: First Blood
programme.desc: Before he hunted down his first victim in the wilds of Alaska, Robert Hansen was a successful businessman with a family in Anchorage, but his intense feelings would build into a dark desire to exert the ultimate control over 17 victims.

programme.title: First Blood
programme.desc: One of the most well-known serial killers, Richard Ramirez terrorized Southern California in the mid-1980s, where anyone could be a target of the sadistic murderer.

programme.title: First Blood
programme.desc: Someone is killing young African American women in Charlotte, N.C., and the police seem unable to stop it; what the police don't realize is that the cases all have a commonality, which is a connection with Henry Louis Wallace.

programme.title: First Blood
programme.desc: The articulate and boastful killer is remembered for terrifying the coastal town of Santa Cruz, where he picked up and dismembered hitchhiking college students in the early 1970s.

programme.title: First Blood
programme.desc: Known primarily for the murders of University of Florida students, a man's first murders were in his hometown of Shreveport, La.; the man dreamed of having a loving family as an adult, but his dark fantasies drove him to destroy a family instead.

programme.desc: Erin Corwin's mother, Lore Heavilin, talks about her daughter's story and her legacy after her tragic death.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When a California man was found dismembered in 1990, police suspected a local burglar, but they couldn't find him. The FBI would lead a multi-agency manhunt for a killer on a desperate run through the tourist regions of the west.
